title: To avoid duplicating code, define common methods and attributes in a general class as a base:

inline_content.Text: To avoid duplicating code, define common methods and attributes in a general class as a base:

title: Now that you have a class that represents
Animal
c
in general, you can define a class that describes the peculiarities of specific animals:

inline_content.Text: Now that you have a class that represents
in general, you can define a class that describes the peculiarities of specific animals:

title: The Cat class gets access to not only the methods described in its definition explicitly, but also all the methods defined in the general
Animal
c

base class. Any Animal (whether or not it was a Cat) could Eat, Stare, or Roll. An Animal would not be able to Scratch, however, unless it was also a Cat. You could then define other classes describing other animals. (Such as Gopher with a method for destroying flower gardens and Sloth with no extra methods at all.)

inline_content.Text: The Cat class gets access to not only the methods described in its definition explicitly, but also all the methods defined in the general

base class. Any Animal (whether or not it was a Cat) could Eat, Stare, or Roll. An Animal would not be able to Scratch, however, unless it was also a Cat.
